fields.title: Senior Director of Community and Pastoral Care
Worth More
fields.subtitle: After Abortion Care
fields.summary: Worth More is a Christ-centered, after abortion care ministry offering hope and healing to women and men.

fields.questions: Are you considering adding more Elders?
fields.answers:
- We are always looking for men who are qualified to hold the office of Elder. We continue to seek God’s leading as additions to the Elder team are considered.
- It is critical for Elders to maintain the spirit of unity and the bond of peace (Ephesians 4:3-6). The larger the Elder team grows, the more difficult it is to maintain those relationships.

To learn more about the role of Elders at Watermark, [read full whitepaper](https://assets.ctfassets.net/hw5pse7y1ojx/3nmc9CP6cnj85rbEIvNYF9/86d91de2ee420a03cb38cad0a96f74f7/Elder_Handout_Web_Copy_June_11_2020.pdf).

fields.title: International Prayer
fields.description:
It can be overwhelming to pray for the world in meaningful ways. If you are wondering where to start, check out some of our favorite resources to guide you in praying for countries all across the world. 

Pray in particular for our partners who work in Haiti, the Dominican Republic, Turks and Caicos, El Salvador, India, Iran, Ethiopia, and much of Central Africa.

- [Joshua Project](https://joshuaproject.net/pray)
- [Operation world](http://operationworld.org/today-pray)
- [Prayer cast](https://prayercast.com/)

fields.title: Watermark Family Prayer Email
fields.description:
As part of the [Membership Covenant](https://www.watermark.org/covenant/), all Members commit to praying for the health and impact of our church. To that end, all active Watermark Members are invited to sign up to receive the Watermark Family Prayer email. Throughout the week, we'll send you prayer requests from other Members. Note: this resource is only available for active Watermark Members.

[Sign Up](https://my.watermark.org/forms/189){: .btn .btn-primary}

fields.title: Prayer Ministries
fields.summary: At Watermark, we are passionate about prayer. We believe the attitude and action of prayer is essential to everything we do and has an eternal impact. Join us as we practice and grow in prayer together.

fields.body:
I grew up in Weatherford, TX with an amazing family who loved the Lord. I do not have a memory without Jesus being in my life, which is one of my greatest blessing. I knew from a young age that the Lord was calling me into ministry, I just wasn’t sure when or how that would happen, I was just along for the ride. I have had a passion for local and global ministries since high school, as I served at city camps and traveled to 3rd world countries on mission trips. Likewise, the Lord began stirring a burden in my heart for women with unexpected pregnancies while in college at Dallas Baptist University, as I served with my sorority to provide mothers with baby showers to celebrate them choosing life! So, joining the External Focus team has been one of the greatest joys, as all of the desires the Lord has put in my heart and prepared me for are all in one place!  I am humbled to be able to serve the body of Christ in my role and look forward to watching all the Lord does in and through His ministry! 

I recently married the love of my life and best friend, Chase Reyes and we live just a hop and a skip away from Dallas, over in Farmer’s Branch! You can find us going on walks, finding new coffee shops every weekend, and hanging out with close friends most days. We are both ecstatic to be a part of Watermark and serve in any way the Lord calls!

fields.header:
### Prayer Resources

Listed below are some prayer resources you may find helpful as part of your prayer life.

fields.body:
So, with grateful hearts and a monumental mission, we seek to call all people to become fully-devoted followers of Christ. We are always looking for faithful servants to join us on this mission.

If you have a heart for strengthening and serving the Bride of Christ – His Church – and believe that God may be calling you to serve at any of our campuses (Dallas, Rockwall, and South Dallas), please review the available positions. If you meet the qualifications, we invite you to fill out an application, and email the contact listed for each open position (if listed). Due to the large number of applications that we receive, we are only able to contact candidates selected for interviews.

To be considered for a position, you must be an active Member or [willing to become one](https://www.watermark.org/membership).

"...who redeems your life from the pit,
who crowns you with steadfast love and mercy....
Psalm 103:4

fields.body:
#### Experience support and know every life is worth more than what abortion offers. 

Groups meet weekly in Fall & Spring sessions. All groups are facilitated by women walking in freedom with Christ after abortion to share God loves you and sees you right where you are! Take the next step and join us.

fields.title: The Watermark Institute
fields.description:
The Watermark Institute is your opportunity to get first-hand ministry experience and in-depth biblical training surrounded by an authentic community of leaders. It’s way more than internship; it’s a one-year program to invest in, develop, and deploy the next generation of church leaders. Opportunities within the Watermark Institute include: the Fellowship, Residency, Church Planting Cohort, and Worship Leader Track.

[More Information](https://www.watermarkresources.com/ministries/institute){: .btn .btn-info}

fields.body: ## Current Job Openings

fields.title: School Impact
fields.descriptiveTitle: Loving and Serving Our Local Schools

fields.body:
# Job Opportunities at Watermark
What's it like to work at Watermark? In a word: awesome. It's challenging, purposeful, joyful, adventurous, and rewarding. We're a family working together to do God's bidding. We think this is one of the best places to work. If you don't believe us, just ask the [Dallas Morning News](https://www.dallasnews.com/business/top-100/2019/11/14/watermark-finds-that-patience-is-a-virtue/).

God's Word is our only playbook, and we know the Lord wants to use His people, the Church, in radical ways to make His name great. God is constantly doing great works and deploying His people, so we frequently ask, “Lord, why not use us?"

fields.metaDescription: Consistent with the exhortation of Scripture, Watermark is led by a team of Elders (Pastors), rather than one man who reports to a "board."

fields.body:
*After 8 years at Watermark, Nathan Wagnon is continuing his ministry with the [Eden Project](https://www.edeninitiatives.org/).*

I began my journey of discipleship to Jesus as a child and consistently grew in the context of a strong Christian family. After graduating from Ouachita Baptist University and Dallas Seminary I figured I would apply what I had learned in a different environment, so I joined the Army. After my second deployment to Afghanistan I began to sense the Lord pushing me into vocational ministry which brought me back to Watermark as a member of the Watermark Institute Resident class of 2014.

I loved serving on Watermark's Equipping team to equip people to use their gifts for the kingdom of God. Margaret and I married in 2009 and we have two sons, Nate and Miles, and two daughters, Jules and Joy. We enjoy traveling, snow-skiing and hanging with friends.

fields.title: Prayer at Watermark
fields.description:
We invite you to serve with Prayer Engine Room during any weekend service to pray alongside others for the service, the campus, attendees, teachers, and children.

- Register for [Prayer Engine Room](/events/699)

Many of our ministries have teams to pray for the ministry, attendees, and leaders during meetings and events.

- [See all Watermark Prayer service opportunities](/search/serve?query=prayer&refinementList%5Bcampuses.name%5D=&refinementList%5Bministries.title%5D=)

fields.questions: What is the process for adding Elders?
fields.answers:
When evaluating a potential Elder, we look for the "3Ms:"

- Maturity: General maturity and spiritual maturity.
- Marriage: The health of the marriage and the maturity of the spouse. If there is not a ministry at home, then there is not a ministry with others.
- Margin: Enough available time to fulfill the requirements of being an Elder.

Once a potential Elder is identified, the Elder team will walk through an extensive process with them, including the following:

- Several personal meetings
- Spending time with their family, community, and business associates
- A written and oral "exam:" [doctrinal and current event questions](http://www.watermark.org/blog/36-theological-questions-ask-elders-ask)
- Group meetings with other core leaders for multiple weeks
- Pastoral care meetings
- Staff feedback
- Church body feedback

fields.body:
As God is allowing us to minister to and shepherd a growing number of people across Dallas and beyond, we are thankful for His abundant provision of shared leadership across our Elders, staff leadership, and countless faithful lay leaders.

## Elders
Consistent with the exhortation of Scripture, Watermark is led by a team of Elders (Pastors), rather than one man who reports to a "board." This team of Elders (Pastors) governs, corrects, cares for (shepherds), and [oversees the spiritual interests of the church](/about/governance#elders). An Elder must be a Member of this church and lead a life that meets the qualifications of Scripture and embodies the calling, convictions, and commitments of Watermark Community Church.

fields.body:
## Dallas Leadership Team

The Dallas Leadership Team is appointed by the Lead Pastor. Each person on the team oversees a specific group of Watermark ministries and shares in the leadership of the Watermark campus as a whole.
